intro: Anthyllis vulneraria subsp. lusitanica, commonly known as the Lusitanian Scotch broom, is a perennial flowering plant native to southern Europe. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its yellow flowers and compound leaves. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky or sandy soils, often in open habitats such as scrublands and grasslands. It is known for its ability to fix nitrogen, which helps improve soil fertility in nutrient-poor environments.
